title: If the cost price of 10 articles is equal to the selling price of 9 articles, what is the gain or loss percent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Answer: Gain percent = 11.111 % Solution: Let ‘x’ be the cost price of 10 articles. Cost price of unit article = x/10 Selling price of 9 articles = x Selling price of unit article = x/9 Gain per unit article = (x/9) - (x/10) = x(1/9–1/10) = x (1/90) = x/90 Percentage of gain (%) = (Gain/Cost)100 = ((x/90)/(x/10))100 = (x/90)(10/x)100 = (10/90)100 = 100/9 = 11.111

Once again a ten second problem . Let C , P , and S be the cost price , the profit , and the selling price of one piece of that article respectively. So 10C=9c+9P . Or C=9P , Or P=C/9 . So the %age profit =100 x (C/9)/C=100/9=11.11%//

Let the cost price of an article is Rs. x , then cost price of 10 articles is Rs. 10.x Accordingly :- Selling price of 9 articles = Rs 10.x S.P. of an article = Rs.10x/9. Gain = Rs(10x/9- x)= Rs.x/9 Gain % = (x/9)×100/x = 100/9% or. 11.11 %. Answer.

Let cost 10 articles be 100 The cost price of 1 articles=100/10=10 The sale amount of 9 article=100 The sale price of 1 article=100/9=11.11 The gain=11.11–10.00=1.11 The gain percent=1.11/10*100=11.10%

let the cost price of 1 article = Rs 1. cost price of 9 articles = Rs 1 x 9 = Rs 9 selling price of 9 articles = cost price of 10 articles = Rs 10 S.P > C.P, so there is profit. profit = 10 -9 = 1 profit % = 1 x 100/9 = 11 1/9%

Let CP of 1 article be x. Therefore CP of 9 articles =9x and 10 articles is 10x. Now, it is given that SP of 9 articles= CP of 10 articles. Therefore SP of 9 articles = 10x. Profit =x. Profit%= x/9x×100 = 11 11%
Let x and y be CP & SP per piece 10x=9y. or y=10/9x Since SP y is more than CP x, there is profit. % profit=(SP-CP)/CP.100=(10/9–1)x/x.100 100/9=11.11%
